definition: to disturb/to create confusion/to make a din
variant of 鬧|闹[nao4]
noisy/cacophonous/to make noise/to disturb/to vent (feelings)/to fall ill/to have an attack (of sickness)/to go in (for some activity)/to joke
to soar/to gallop/to prance/to turn over/to vacate/to clear

sentences.english: One fall morning, the class was abuzz with excitment.
sentences.chinese: 一个秋天的上午，全班闹腾起来。

sentences.english: Consoling a colicky baby night after night is terribly hard.
sentences.chinese: 没日没夜的照顾小闹腾非常的辛苦。

sentences.english: Delicate went into your home Naoteng of Guo.
sentences.chinese: 玲珑又去郭湘成府上闹腾了。

sentences.english: For this reason, we both make a night of old mouth didn't sleep well.
sentences.chinese: 为此，我们老俩口闹腾的一夜也没睡好。

sentences.english: Then make sure your side fights like it's life or death.
sentences.chinese: 还要确保你这边的人闹腾得像生死抉择一样。

sentences.english: They came to a river, and she grew very restless, fearing to cross the water.
sentences.chinese: 他们来到河边，水精不敢过河，闹腾起来。

sentences.english: They were there Naoteng, she almost shock.
sentences.chinese: 他们俩在那里闹腾，老板娘差点休克。

definition: variant of 鬧|闹[nao4]
noisy/cacophonous/to make noise/to disturb/to vent (feelings)/to fall ill/to have an attack (of sickness)/to go in (for some activity)/to joke
to calm down/to stop/to pause/calmly/peaceful/restful
to make a racket/to quarrel
to toss from side to side (e.g. sleeplessly)/to repeat sth over and over again/to torment sb/to play crazy/to squander (time, money)
to make a lot of noise/to be disorderly
to create a big disturbance
noisy/raucous/to shout and scream
to make an (unnecessary) racket (idiom)
to make a scene/to fool around/to behave foolishly
lit. chickens flying and dogs jumping (idiom)/fig. in chaos/in disarray
to disturb/to look for trouble/to stir up a row/to bother sb intentionally
to quarrel/to make a noise/noisy/to disturb by making a noise
to bounce/to jump/to hop/also variant of 蹦達|蹦达[beng4 da2]
clamorous/noisy/sensational/very exciting
content with one's lot/knowing one's place
to make a racket/clamour/uproar
